1 avocado - peeled, pitted, and cut into chunks
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Spread potato nuggets out onto a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until nuggets are golden brown and crisp, 22 to 24 minutes.

Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Arrange potato nuggets on an oven-proof platter and cover evenly with ground beef; spread Mexican cheese and pepperjack cheese over the top.

Cook potato nuggets under the broiler until cheese melts, 1 to 3 minutes. Whisk sour cream and lime juice together in a bowl. Top potato nuggets with tomatoes, black olives, jalapenos, avocado, sour cream mixture, scallions, and cilantro, respectively.

recipes.name: Baked Cream Cheese Jalapeno Poppers
ingredients: 12 jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
2 tablespoons fine bread crumbs, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil or parchment paper.
Bake until the peppers are just tender, 20 to 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Taco Tuesday Casserole
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
8 corn tortilla chips, or more to taste
\u00bc cup diced tomatoes, or to taste (Optional)
2 tablespoons chopped olives, or to taste (Optional)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Line the prepared baking dish with tortillas and top with 1/2 of the ground beef mixture. Spoon 1/2 of the corn over the beef layer and top with 1/3 of the Cheddar cheese. Crush tortilla chips over cheese layer. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, ending with Cheddar cheese, tomatoes, and olives.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through and cheese is melted, 15 to 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Chipotle Taco Burger
ingredients: 3 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, seeded and diced
directions: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
Cook burgers on preheated grill until firm, hot, and grey in the center, 7 to 10 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C).

recipes.name: Super Easy Southwest-Style Quinoa (Cooked in Rice Cooker)
ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chile peppers (such as RO*TEL\u00ae), undrained
1 (1.25 ounce) package dry taco seasoning mix
directions: Cook quinoa mixture on the "brown rice" setting, about 1 hour.

recipes.name: Easy Cheesy Bean Dip
ingredients: 1 (11.5 ounce) can condensed bean with bacon soup

recipes.name: Taco Salad with Lime Vinegar Dressing
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
\u00bd cup chopped carrots, or to taste
\u00bd cup chopped green bell pepper, or to taste
\u00bd cup chopped celery, or to taste
\u00bc cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste (Optional)
2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste (Optional)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Mix romaine lettuce, kidney beans, tomatoes, avocado, carrots, green bell pepper, celery, and Cheddar cheese in a large bowl; top with ground beef.
Whisk lime juice, honey, vinegar, cilantro, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until dressing is well mixed; served alongside salad.

recipes.name: Lee's Taco Salad
ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or to taste
directions: Pile lettuce into the bottom of a large salad bowl; top with the turkey mixture, corn, black beans, avocado, green onions, Cheddar cheese, and spicy ranch dressing.

recipes.name: Layered Taco Dip with Meat
ingredients: 2 (1.25 ounce) packages mild taco seasoning mix (such as McCormick\u00ae), divided
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
1 (8 ounce) jar salsa, or to taste
directions: Stir sour cream, cream cheese, and remaining taco seasoning mix together in a bowl until smooth.

Spread sour cream mixture onto a baking sheet to cover. Sprinkle about half the Cheddar cheese over the sour cream layer; top evenly with the ground beef, lettuce, and remaining Cheddar cheese, respectively. Spoon salsa over the dip.
Refrigerate at least 1 hour.

recipes.name: Southwestern Macaroni and Cheese with Ground Turkey
ingredients: 2 (6 ounce) boxes Horizon\u00ae ClassicMac\u2122 Macaroni & Mild Cheddar Cheese
1 tablespoon taco seasoning, or to taste
6 ounces Horizon\u00ae Organic Mexican finely shredded cheese
directions: Prepare Horizon macaroni and cheese according to package directions.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add turkey, red onion, and red bell pepper. Saute, breaking up turkey, until turkey is cooked through and onions are translucent.
Serve topped with sliced green onions.

recipes.name: Easy Mexican Quinoa
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Pour water into quinoa mixture. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover the saucepan with a lid, and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir beans and tomatoes into quinoa mixture, cover the saucepan again with the lid, and simmer until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed, about 5 minutes more. Stir Cheddar cheese into quinoa, spoon into bowls, and top each with a dollop of sour cream.

recipes.name: Mexican Cheese and Hamburger Dip
ingredients: 1 (2 pound) loaf processed cheese food (such as Velveeta\u00ae), cut into cubes
directions: Cook and stir hamburger and onion together in a skillet over medium heat until the hamburger is completely browned, 7 to 10 minutes.
Put cheese cubes into the crock of your slow cooker; add the hamburger mixture, green chiles, tomato sauce, and jalapeno peppers.
Cook on Low, stirring occasionally, until the cheese is melted and smooth, about 45 minutes.

recipes.name: Mexican Chicken Quinoa Salad
ingredients: 2 chicken breasts, cut into small cubes
directions: Mix chicken and remaining taco seasoning mix together in a bowl; let sit for chicken to season, about 10 minutes.

Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir chicken until no longer pink in the center, 5 to 10 minutes. Place chicken and quinoa in a bowl and place in freezer until cooled, about 5 minutes.
Combine avocado, red onion, celery, spinach, carrot, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, cucumber, and jalapeno peppers in a large bowl; add chicken-quinoa mixture and salsa and mix well.

recipes.name: Taco-Stuffed Zucchini Boats
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL\u00ae Mexican Lime & Cilantro)
1 (1 ounce) packet sour cream seasoning mix (such as Old El Paso\u00ae Zesty Sour Cream Seasoning Mix)
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease the bottom of a 13x9-inch baking dish.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook zucchini halves in boiling water to just soften slightly, about 1 minute. Remove zucchini halves from the water and arrange into the prepared baking dish with the cut sides facing upwards.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.
Stir sour cream and sour cream seasoning mix together in a bowl.

Using a slotted spoon, spoon the turkey mixture into the hollows of each zucchini half and press firmly. Top the turkey mixture with about half the sour cream mixture. Sprinkle green onions, Muenster cheese, and Cheddar cheese over the sour cream mixture, respectively.
Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and the zucchini is cooked through, about 30 minutes. Top with remaining sour cream mixture.

recipes.name: Busy Day Slow Cooker Taco Soup
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, drained and rinsed
1 (1 ounce) package buttermilk ranch dressing mix
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
Cook on Low for at least 3 hours.

recipes.name: Fiesta Slow Cooker Shredded Chicken Tacos
directions: Cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours. Shred chicken.

recipes.name: Cheesy Rice Stuffed Jalapeno Poppers
ingredients: 1 (8.8 ounce) pouch UNCLE BEN'S\u00ae Ready Rice\u00ae Original Long Grain or Whole Grain Brown
12 large jalapeno peppers, halved lengthwise, seeds and membranes removed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Prepare rice according to package directions. Allow to cool slightly.
Fill each jalapeno half with about a teaspoon of rice mixture, depending on size of jalapeno. Arrange filled jalapeno halves on prepared baking sheet.
Mix panko bread crumbs and melted butter together in a small bowl. Top filled jalapenos with crumb mixture.
Bake poppers in preheated oven until lightly golden on top, about 15 to 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Sun-Dried Tomato and Basil Yogurt Tacos
directions: Stir yogurt and basil together in a bowl; place in refrigerator.

Spoon about 1 tablespoon yogurt mixture into each taco shell; layer in beef mixture, mozzarella cheese, cucumber, carrots, and a few strips of sun-dried tomato. Top with hot sauce and remaining yogurt.

recipes.name: Taco Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 4 bell peppers, tops and seeds removed
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend
directions: Combine water, Mexican rice mix, and butter in a saucepan; bring to a boil for 1 minute. Cover saucepan, reduce heat to low, and cook until water is absorbed, about 25 minutes. Mix ground beef into rice mixture.

Bring a pot of water to a boil; cook green bell peppers until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Drain. Fill each bell pepper with beef-rice mixture. Arrange bell peppers in a baking dish. Pour ranch dressing over bell peppers and top each with Mexican cheese blend.
Bake in the preheated oven until peppers are tender and cheese is melted, 45 to 50 minutes.

recipes.name: Taco Taters
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package frozen bite-size potato nuggets (such as Tater Tots\u00ae)
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Spread beef mixture over bottom of 9x13-inch baking dish. Arrange potato nuggets over beef mixture, sprinkle black olives, jalapenos, and Cheddar cheese on top.
Bake in preheated oven until potato nuggets are crisp and cheese is bubbly, about 25 minutes. Garnish with sour cream.

recipes.name: Taco Ring
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Mix ground beef mixture, 1/2 of the Cheddar cheese, and 1/2 of the sour cream together in a bowl.

Roll crescent roll dough out onto a baking stone in the shape of a sunflower, with the triangle points pointing outward. Spread ground beef mixture onto dough in a circular shape. Wrap pointed end of dough around the beef mixture, sealing to the other end of dough making a ring-shape.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 25 minutes. Serve alongside the remaining Cheddar cheese and sour cream.

recipes.name: Mexican Taco Ring
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Remove crescent roll dough from packaging and separate into individual pieces.

Arrange crescent roll triangles in a circle with the points facing outward on a pizza stone or pan. Spoon ground beef mixture into the center of each dough piece, creating a ring shape. Sprinkle Mexican cheese blend over ground beef mixture. Fold crescent roll points toward the middle, sealing the dough together.
Bake in the preheated oven until dough is lightly browned, 11 to 13 minutes.

recipes.name: Cheesy Taco Potato Puff Casserole
ingredients: \u00bd (28 ounce) package Alexia\u00ae Crispy Seasoned Potato Puffs
1 (10 ounce) can Ro*Tel\u00ae Original Diced Tomatoes & Green Chilies, drained
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
Bake 25 minutes or until potatoes are golden brown and crisp, turning gently once halfway. Remove from oven; sprinkle with cheese.

recipes.name: CocoChi
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Pour pear juice into a casserole dish; add chicken. Pour coconut cream over chicken and season with pepper, salt, and cinnamon sugar.

Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Flip chicken and continue baking until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).

recipes.name: Pressure Cooker Taco Pulled Pork
ingredients: 1 (3 pound) boneless pork shoulder blade roast
directions: Trim excess fat from pork; divide meat into 4 equal portions. Season each portion with salt.

Pour broth into a pressure cooker with rack insert; place pork on rack. Place lid on pressure cooker and lock; bring to low pressure over medium-low heat until pork is tender and shreds easily, about 45 minutes. Let pressure come down naturally, about 15 minutes. Shred pork using 2 forks.

recipes.name: Baked Nacho Lasagna
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) bag nacho cheese-flavored corn chips (such as Doritos\u00ae), crushed
1\u2009\u00bd cups shredded Cheddar cheese, or more to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place refried beans in a small saucepan and heat over low heat, covered, until warmed through, about 5 minutes.

Spread a thin layer of salsa on the bottom of a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Layer half of the crushed chips, seasoned beef, beans, corn, olives, and cheese on top. Repeat layers with remaining ingredients, starting with salsa and ending with cheese.
Bake nacho lasagna in the oven until bubbly and cheese is melted, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Real Nacho Cheese Sauce
ingredients: \u00bd cup milk, or more as needed
directions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Whisk in cornstarch until paste forms, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Whisk in milk gradually until smooth, 1 to 2 minutes. Simmer until thickened to sauce consistency, about 2 minutes.

recipes.name: Spam\u00ae Tacos
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) can lite luncheon meat (such as Spam\u00ae)
\u00bd (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix, or more to taste
2 tablespoons water, or more as needed
directions: Shred luncheon meat onto a large plate using a cheese grater.
Spray another skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-high heat. Place 1 tortilla in the skillet and cook until heated through, about 30 seconds per side. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Top warm tortillas with luncheon meat, lettuce, Cheddar cheese, olives, tomato, and onion.

recipes.name: Mexican Stuffed Shells with Turkey
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta shells in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 12 minutes. Drain.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Spread salsa in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Stuff each pasta shell with some of the turkey mixture and arrange on top of the salsa in the baking dish. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese on top. Cover pan with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Mexican Stuffed Shells
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain well.
Stir refried beans, Cheddar cheese, and green chiles into ground beef; cook and stir until cheese is melted and mixture is smooth, about 5 minutes. Fill shells with beef mixture.
Combine tomato sauce and picante sauce in a saucepan over medium-low heat; cook and stir until heated through, 5 to 7 minutes. Spread 1/2 cup sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Arrange stuffed shells side-by-side in the baking dish and top with remaining sauce. Cover dish with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 40 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Taco Chili from Publix\u00ae
ingredients: 2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes and green chiles, undrained
1 (15 ounce) can chili beans in sauce, undrained
1 (15.25 ounce) can southwest-style corn with peppers, drained
directions: Combine remaining ingredients in slow cooker; stir in meat. Cover and cook on HIGH 3-4 hours or LOW 6-8 hours. Serve.

recipes.name: Quick Taco Bake Pie
ingredients: \u00bd (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained (Optional)
1 (8.5 ounce) package corn bread mix (such as Jiffy\u00ae)
directions: Grease a 9-inch pie pan or casserole dish.

Mix corn bread mix, milk, egg, honey, and corn oil together in a bowl until batter is smooth; stir in corn. Pour batter into pie pan. Layer ground beef mixture over batter; sprinkle with Cheddar cheese. Top with corn chips.
Place in a cold oven; set temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Bake until sides are golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes.

recipes.name: Chicken Fajita Pasta Bake
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (16 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in ziti and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; add onion and green pepper. Cook and stir until soft, 5 to 7 minutes; remove from skillet. Place chicken into the skillet; cook and stir until no longer pink, 7 to 10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine ziti, chicken, salsa mixture, black beans, corn, and onion mixture in a large bowl. Add 8 ounces Cheddar cheese; mix until combined. Pour into a baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove from oven; top with remaining Cheddar cheese. Bake until cheese is melted, about 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Mexican Fiesta Bites
ingredients: 12 each Original Snack Factory\u00ae Pretzel Crisps\u00ae
1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix, or to taste
1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste
1 tablespoon shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste
directions: Add a layer of guacamole, then salsa, and a dollop of sour cream.
Top with some chopped tomatoes, a sprinkle of chopped cilantro, and Cheddar cheese. Place an olive slice on the top.

recipes.name: Taco Bake Casserole
ingredients: 15 taco shells, broken up, or more to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking spray.

Place half of the taco shells in the bottom of the baking dish. Pour in half of the ground beef mixture; sprinkle with half of the Cheddar cheese. Repeat with remaining taco shells, ground beef mixture, and Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, 20 to 25 minutes.

recipes.name: Award-Winning White Chicken Chili
ingredients: 1 (10.5 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chile peppers
\u00bd cup shredded pepper Jack cheese, or to taste
directions: Layer chicken, great Northern beans, and corn into a slow cooker.
Cover and cook on Low until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 8 to 10 hours. Stir in sour cream and pepper Jack cheese; cover and cook until cheese is melted, 3 to 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Baked Mexican Chips on a Stick
ingredients: 2 teaspoons taco seasoning mix, or to taste
2 teaspoons sriracha sauce, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and grease with cooking spray.
Slice each potato into long spirals using a spiralizer fitted with the straight-flat blade. Cut each spiral into 3 shorter pieces.
Thread a skewer through the middle of each potato spiral. Gently push down to fan out spiral.
Roast in the preheated oven until browned and crisp, 17 to 18 minutes. Season with sriracha sauce and sea salt.

recipes.name: Bulgur Chili
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
1 (28 ounce) can petite diced tomatoes, undrained
directions: Pour water and bulgur into a saucepan. Bring to a boil; cover and simmer until tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Drain off excess water.

Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add carrots, onions, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, and jalapeno pepper; cook and stir until softened and starting to brown, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.

recipes.name: Ranch Taco Chicken Dip
ingredients: 2 (12.5 fl oz) cans white meat chicken
directions: Cook on Low until warmed through, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Lettuce Wrap Tacos
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
Pull lettuce "cups" out of the center of each half. Fill with garbanzo bean mixture. Top with avocado, tomato, and olives.

recipes.name: Taco Pie from Borden\u00ae Cheese
ingredients: 1 cup Borden\u00ae Sharp Cheddar Shredded Cheese
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray the inside of a 9 x 9 baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Unroll the crescents and line the inside of the prepared baking dish pinching all the edges together and overlap if needed to form a solid layer of rolls; set aside.
Cook ground beef in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until browned; drain fat. Add taco mix and water. Cook until most of moisture has evaporated.

Sprinkle 1 cup of taco chips on top of rolls; top with meat mixture, followed by sour cream and shredded cheese. Bake 20 minutes at 350 degrees F or until crescents have browned and sauce has begun to bubble at the edges. Top with remaining taco chips, and bake 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Tangy Turkey Taco Cups
ingredients: 1 (16.3 ounce) can refrigerated flaky biscuit dough
3 slices Borden\u00ae American Singles, cut into 4 small squares
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Separate 6 biscuits into 2 rounds each. Gently stretch each round into a 5-inch circle. Press into cups of a non-stick muffin tin.
Fill biscuit-lined muffin cups with turkey mixture.
Bake in preheated oven until browned and hot, about 13 minutes.
Divide each slice of cheese into quarters, and place one-quarter slice on top of each filled cup.
Bake 3 minutes more, or until cheese is melted.
Allow to cool in the pan 5 minutes, then place on a rack until cool enough to eat.

recipes.name: Dairy Free Chili Queso Dip
ingredients: 1\u2009\u00bd cups cashews, soaked overnight and drained
1 cup So Delicious\u00ae Dairy Free Unsweetened Cashewmilk Beverage
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Place the cashews, orange bell pepper, Cashewmilk, chili powder, and nutritional yeast in a high-powered blender and puree, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Add in the cheese mixture and stir to combine. Season to taste with salt/pepper and garnish with cilantro and/or sliced green onions before serving.
Enjoy with your favorite chips or raw vegetables!

recipes.name: Southwestern Stuffed Bell Peppers (Low Carb)
ingredients: 3 large green bell peppers - halved, seeded, and membranes removed
1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into strips
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 teaspoon lime juice, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil; cook peppers until just soft, 6 to 7 minutes. Drain and transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Cook and stir onion and garlic in the same skillet over medium heat until tender, 5 to 10 minutes.
Mix onion mixture, black beans, tomato sauce, and cauliflower rice into the bowl of chicken. Stir in 1 1/2 tablespoons taco seasoning. Fill the bell pepper halves with the chicken mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, 10 to 15 minutes. Top chicken mixture with Cheddar cheese and continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes more.
Mix Greek yogurt, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2 teaspoon taco seasoning together in a bowl; serve over stuffed peppers.

recipes.name: Shredded Spam\u00ae Tacos
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) can low-sodium canned luncheon meat (such as SPAM\u00ae)
2 (2.5 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained
directions: Spray a separate skillet with cooking spray and place over medium-high heat; add 1 tortilla and cook until heated through, about 1 minute per side. Repeat with remaining tortillas.
Layer luncheon meat, lettuce, Cheddar cheese, tomato, onion, and black olives onto each tortilla.

recipes.name: Southwest Layered Salad
ingredients: 1 (1 ounce) package dry ranch dressing mix (such as Hidden Valley Ranch\u00ae)
\u00bd (1.25 ounce) package taco seasoning mix, or more to taste
1 (14 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (4 ounce) can diced green chile peppers
1 large avocado - peeled, pitted, and sliced
directions: Line a large serving bowl with the torn lettuce.

Mix roasted peppers, black beans, corn, onion, and green chiles together in a bowl. Spread mixture over the lettuce. Top with tomatoes; sprinkle with Cheddar cheese. Arrange avocado slices in an overlapping circle. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with dressing on the side.

recipes.name: Meatless Dairy-Free Taco Dip
ingredients: \u00bd cup canned diced tomatoes with green chile peppers and onions
directions: Combine garbanzo beans, diced tomatoes, roasted red pepper, jalapeno pepper, sriracha sauce, garlic powder, and chili powder in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until beans are soft and heated through, about 15 minutes. Drain all but 1 tablespoon liquid from the mixture.
Pour bean mixture into a food processor; puree to desired consistency. Spoon dip into a serving bowl.

recipes.name: Taco Pizza with Grilled Halloumi
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sliced black olives, or to taste
1 cup tortilla chips, crushed, or to taste
2 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste
1 teaspoon hot sauce, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Spread pizza crust on a pizza pan or large baking sheet. Cover with pizza sauce. Sprinkle Mexican cheese blend on top. Cover cheese with beef mixture, halloumi cheese, olives, and jalapeno pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is crispy and the Mexican cheese blend is melted, about 15 minutes.
Sprinkle crushed tortilla chips over pizza. Top with cherry tomatoes, lettuce, and onion. Garnish with salsa, sour cream, and hot sauce.

recipes.name: Taco Pockets
ingredients: 4 slices pepper Jack cheese, halved on the diagonal
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Unroll crescent dough triangles onto the prepared baking sheet. Cut each triangle in half. Top dough triangles with pepper Jack cheese slices. Divide beef mixture evenly over cheese; top with tomato and cilantro. Fold up dough to enclose filling.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 13 to 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Jackfruit Vegan Tacos
ingredients: 2 (20 ounce) cans jackfruit in brine - drained, rinsed, and cut into bite-sized pieces
1 tablespoon water, or more as needed
2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix, or to taste
directions: Place a small amount of jackfruit in each taco shell; add 2 tablespoons salsa.

recipes.name: Taco Skillet Burgers
ingredients: 1 (11.5 ounce) can condensed bean with bacon soup
\u00bd cup corn chips (such as Fritos\u00ae, crushed
directions: Cook patties in a large skillet over medium heat until no longer pink in the center, about 4 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Drain fat and wipe the skillet with a paper towel.

Mix soup and water in a bowl. Pour over patties in the skillet; simmer until soup mixture is heated through, about 5 minutes. Mix in tomato, Cheddar cheese, corn chips, and olives. Scoop out the taco burgers and serve once cheese has melted.

recipes.name: Easy Slow Cooker Chicken Fajitas
ingredients: 1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
directions: Cook on Low until chicken is tender and flavors have combined, about 8 hours.
Shred chicken meat using 2 forks.

recipes.name: Veggie Tacos
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Divide mushroom filling evenly between tortillas. Add your favorite taco toppings.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Salsa Chicken
ingredients: 1 pound frozen skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
directions: Place lid on the pot and lock in place. Select the Poultry setting and set the timer for 15 minutes. Allow pressure to release naturally after the cooking time has ended, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of the chicken should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Shred the cooked chicken.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Chickpea Tacos
ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1 (1 ounce) package taco seasoning mix (such as Taco Bell\u00ae)
directions: Divide chickpea filling evenly among taco shells.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Vegan Taco Soup
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
1 (6 ounce) can diced green chile peppers
1 (12 fluid ounce) can or bottle beer
\u00bd cup crushed tortilla chips, or to taste (Optional)
\u00bc cup chopped green onions, or to taste
directions: Cook on Low until flavors combine, 5 to 9 hours. Serve topped with crushed tortilla chips and green onions.

recipes.name: Low-Carb Chicken Nacho Bites
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package mini sweet bell peppers, halved lengthwise and seeded
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Fill each pepper with as much chicken mixture as possible and place in the baking dish. Sprinkle pepper halves with 1/4 cup Mexican cheese blend. Cover with olives and remaining 1/4 cup cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and peppers have begun to soften, 15 to 20 minutes. Top each cooked pepper with a dollop of pico de gallo and sour cream.

recipes.name: Easy Taco Mac and Cheese
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil. Stir in pasta and return to a boil. Cook pasta uncovered, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain.
Combine the meat sauce, pasta, Colby-Jack cheese, and green onions in a 9x13-inch casserole dish. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 25 minutes.

recipes.name: Easy Keto Beef Tacos
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone mat.
Spread Cheddar cheese into four 6-inch circles, placed 2 inches apart.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese melts and is lightly brown, 6 to 8 minutes.
Cool for 2 to 3 minutes before lifting with a spatula. Place over wooden spoon handle wrapped in aluminum foil balanced over 2 cups/cans. Let taco shells cool completely, about 10 minutes.
Divide beef mixture among cheese taco shells. Top with avocado, lettuce, Cheddar cheese, and tomatoes.

recipes.name: Tailgate Tacos
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 24-cup mini muffin tin with cooking spray.
Line each muffin cup with a wonton wrapper. Add about 1 tablespoon taco beef to each cup. Top with 1 tablespoon shredded Mexican cheese blend.
Bake in the preheated oven until wonton wrappers are browned and crispy and cheese is melted, 12 to 14 minutes.

recipes.name: Crispy Ground Turkey Tostadas
ingredients: 1 red onion, halved and thinly sliced
1 chayote - peeled, halved, seeded, and diced into 1/2-inch pieces
1 poblano pepper - seeds and white ribs removed, diced into 1/2-inch pieces
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Place red onion slices and crema in separate small bowls. Zest limes into another small bowl. Halve limes and squeeze juice into a fourth small bowl.

Stir 1 teaspoon lime juice into the bowl of crema. Add the remaining lime juice to the bowl with the red onions; stir in 1/4 teaspoon salt and let marinate at room temperature until pickled, at least 20 minutes.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chayote and poblano pepper; cook, stirring constantly, until golden and tender, about 10 minutes.
Coat tortillas on both sides with cooking spray. Place tortillas on a large baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until crisped and lightly brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir the lime zest, 1/2 the cilantro, onion powder, and 1/4 teaspoon salt into the chayote-poblano mixture. Pour mixture into a bowl.
Spread guacamole over each crisped tortilla; top with chayote-poblano mixture, ground turkey, pickled onions, lime crema, and remaining cilantro.

recipes.name: Mexican Black Bean and Turkey Wraps
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: Stir cooked rice into the turkey mixture; simmer until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Mexican Ground Turkey Dip
ingredients: 1 jalapeno pepper, diced, or more to taste
1 (1 pound) package processed cheese (such as Velveeta\u00ae), cubed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Add red bell peppers, onion, and jalapeno pepper; saute until onion is just translucent, about 5 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is bubbling, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Mexican Turkey Dip
ingredients: 1 (1.25 ounce) package dry taco seasoning mix
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Layer turkey mixture, refried beans, tortilla chips, enchilada sauce, and American cheese in a 9x13-inch pan. Top with olives.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, 15 to 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Mango Cream Cheese Bean Dip
ingredients: 1 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided
\u00bd cup mango-pineapple salsa (such as Trader Joe's\u00ae Island Salsa)
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bake in the preheated oven until mixture is bubbling and cheese is slightly browned, 20 to 30 minutes. Garnish the top with the remaining green onions and serve with warm tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Easy, Meaty Mexican Casserole
ingredients: 1 (15.5 ounce) can light red kidney beans (including liquid)
1 (15.5 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
1 package taco seasoning mix (such as Old El Paso\u00ae)
1 (8.5 ounce) package dry corn muffin mix (such as Jiffy\u00ae)
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Heat a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Cook and crumble pork and black pepper in the hot pan until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.
Combine corn muffin mix, milk, and egg in a bowl for the corn bread mixture.
Spoon pork mixture into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Top with Colby cheese. Pour and carefully spread corn bread mixture on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until corn bread is golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Mexican Casserole with Leftover Turkey
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed
2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend, divided
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Mix remaining 1 cup salsa with cooked rice and spread evenly into the bottom of an ungreased 10x15-inch baking pan. Pour turkey mixture over rice. Layer 1 cup Cheddar cheese over turkey mixture. Top with tortilla chips. Cover loosely with aluminum foil.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Remove foil and top with remaining 1 cup Cheddar cheese. Continue baking until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Vegan Mexican Casserole
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Spread 1 cup of the chorizo mixture on the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan. Add 2 tortillas to cover. Add half the remaining chorizo mixture and top with vegan Cheddar cheese. Add remaining tortilla shells and remaining chorizo mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbling hot, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Elle's Vegan Jackfruit Taco Filling
ingredients: 2 (20 ounce) cans green jackfruit in brine, drained and shredded (such as Trader Joe's\u00ae)
1 (1 ounce) packet dry taco seasoning mix

recipes.name: Mexican Rice Casserole with Beef and Pork
ingredients: \u00bc (4 ounce) can diced jalapeno peppers, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
\u00bd pound ground beef, or more to taste
\u00bd (1 ounce) packet taco seasoning, or to taste
\u00bd small bunch fresh cilantro, chopped, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat olive oil in a Dutch over over medium-high heat. Add green bell pepper, red bell pepper, onion, and garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add green chiles and jalapenos; cook and stir until starting to soften, 3 to 4 minutes. Add rice; cook until coated in oil, about 3 minutes. Add broth, tomatoes, Southwest seasoning, salt, and pepper. Stir well and bring to a boil. Add lime juice and stir well. Cover with lid.
Transfer to the preheated oven and bake while you prepare the meat, 10 to 15 minutes.

Remove rice from the oven and mix in the meat mixture; sprinkle a few tablespoons of water on top. Continue baking until rice is tender yet firm to the bite, 20 to 25 minutes. Mix in green onions and cilantro; top casserole with Cheddar cheese and mozzarella cheese. Return to oven and bake until cheeses melt, about 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Johnsonville Flame Grilled Southwestern Chicken Soup
ingredients: 1 (9 ounce) package Johnsonville\u00ae Flame Grilled Southwestern Seasoned or Johnsonville\u00ae Flame Grilled Black Pepper & Sea Salt Chicken Breasts, diced
2 (14 ounce) packages frozen Southwest vegetable mix (corn, black beans, poblano peppers, red peppers, and onions)
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles
directions: Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat to low; simmer for 5 minutes or until heated through.
Serve with wonton strips, cheese, and sour cream, if desired.

recipes.name: JJ's Vegan Burritos
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and finely chopped, divided
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease a large pie pan with olive oil.
Fill a tortilla with 1/6 of the black bean mixture and wrap into a burrito. Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling. Place burritos in the prepared pie pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until crisp and slightly brown, about 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Nacho Pizza
ingredients: 2 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Cook beef in a large skillet under no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Drain. Stir in seasoning mix until evenly combined.

Place pizza crust on a work surface. Spread queso dip evenly over the crust. Top with Cheddar cheese, cooked beef mixture, jalapeno, and green onions. Spoon salsa onto the pizza in random spots, making sure it's not mixed in with the other toppings. Sprinkle crushed tortilla chips on top.
Bake in the preheated oven directly on the middle oven rack until cheese is hot and melted, about 8 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

recipes.name: Keto Chicken Taco Shells
ingredients: 1 (12.5 fl oz) can canned chicken breast (such as Trader Joe's\u00ae)
1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Drain the canned chicken thoroughly, getting as much moisture out as possible. Spread chicken on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until dried, about 10 minutes.
Scoop 4 even mounds of the mixture onto the same baking sheet. Flatten into tortilla-sized circles.
Bake in the preheated oven until set, 8 to 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Easy Keto Taco Salad Bowl for 2
directions: Divide lettuce, avocado, tomatoes, and green onions between 2 bowls; place ground beef on top. Top taco bowls with salsa, sour cream, and cilantro.

recipes.name: Spicy Keto Chicken-and-Cheese Casserole
ingredients: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into chunks
1 teaspoon taco seasoning mix, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a baking pan.
Mix salsa, sour cream, and jalapenos together in a bowl and pour over the chicken.
Bake in the preheated oven until hot, about 25 minutes. Remove from oven and cover with Cheddar cheese. Continue baking until cheese melts, about 5 minutes more.
Let casserole cool before cutting into pieces and garnishing with green onions.

recipes.name: Speedy Tortilla Soup
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
directions: Heat oil in a 4-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. Saute onion, garlic, and parsley in hot oil until slightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add chicken and stir until well heated, about 2 minutes.
Garnish bowls with Cheddar cheese and dollops of sour cream.

recipes.name: Mexican Fiestada for School Lunch
ingredients: 1 (1.25 ounce) package dry taco seasoning mix
1 (14 ounce) package prepared pizza dough, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Divide pizza dough in half and flatten each half into a thin crust over a nonstick baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven for 3 minutes. Remove but leave oven on.
Mix pizza sauce, cumin, and salt together in a bowl. Spread 1/2 of the mixture over each pizza crust. Sprinkle beef and Cheddar cheese evenly on top.
Bake until crusts are crunchy and cheese is melted, 10 to 12 minutes.

recipes.name: High-Protein Chicken Taco Egg Mini Muffins
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine eggs, Cheddar cheese, milk, red bell pepper, shallot, mushrooms, chives, jalapeno, hot sauce, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Fold in cooled chicken mixture.
Pour mixture into nonstick mini muffin tins, filling each cup 3/4 of the way.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, about 18 minutes.

recipes.name: Tex-Mex Air Fryer Hash Browns
ingredients: 1\u2009\u00bd pounds potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces
1 jalapeno, seeded and cut into 1-inch rings
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Soak potatoes in cool water for 20 minutes.

Preheat the air fryer to 320 degrees F (160 degrees C). Drain the potatoes, dry them with a clean towel, and transfer to a large bowl. Drizzle 1 tablespoon olive oil over the potatoes and toss to coat. Add them to the preheated air fryer basket. Set the timer for 18 minutes.
Transfer potatoes from the air fryer to the bowl with the vegetable mixture. Return the empty basket to the air fryer and raise the temperature to 356 degrees F (180 degrees C).

Quickly toss the contents of the bowl to mix the potatoes evenly with the vegetables and seasoning. Transfer mixture into the basket. Cook for 6 minutes, shake the basket, and continue cooking until potatoes are browned and crispy, about 5 minutes more. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Taco Bowls
ingredients: \u2153 cup taco seasoning mix (such as Savory Spice\u00ae)
1 (10 ounce) bag yellow rice (such as Vigo\u00ae)
1 (15.25 ounce) can black beans, drained, or to taste
1 (15.25 ounce) can corn kernels, drained, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) package shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste
directions: Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 30 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Meanwhile, bring 2 1/2 cups water to a boil in a large saucepan. Add rice and stir for 1 minute. Cover saucepan tightly. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook until rice is tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Release pressure naturally according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Let cool completely.
Divide beef and rice among 6 reusable containers. Top with equal amounts of black beans, corn, and Cheddar cheese. Cover and refrigerate.

recipes.name: Turkey and Veggie Nachos
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground turkey in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat. Drain and discard grease.
Place refried beans in a microwave-safe bowl and warm in the microwave, 1 to 3 minutes. Place queso dip in a microwave-safe bowl and warm in the microwave, 1 to 3 minutes.
Meanwhile, arrange tortilla chips on a serving plate. Spread warm refried beans and queso dip on top of the chips. Add turkey-vegetable mixture. Top with chopped tomato.

recipes.name: Chicken Taco Lasagna
ingredients: 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1/4-inch strips
2 (1 ounce) packets taco seasoning mix (such as Old El Paso\u00ae)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (8 ounce) package no-boil lasagna noodles, or to taste
directions: Cook chicken mixture over medium heat until firm, about 15 minutes.
Mix 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese, sour cream, and salsa in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
Put a few spoonfuls of the sour cream mixture in the bottom of a 9x9-inch baking dish. Layer noodles and chicken on top. Cover with remaining 1 cup mozzarella cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until noodles are tender and cheese is melted, about 1 hour.

recipes.name: Zucchini Chip Nachos
directions: Trim ends of zucchini; use a mandoline on the thinnest setting to cut zucchini into 1/8-inch slices. Place slices on a plate lined with paper towels, top with additional paper towels, and press down to remove excess moisture.
Divide chips between 2 microwave-safe plates. Add black olives, red onion, jalapeno peppers, and Cheddar cheese. Microwave on high power until cheese is melted, about 30 seconds.

recipes.name: Steak Nachos
ingredients: 1 pound flat iron steaks, cut into small pieces
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (12 ounce) bag tortilla chips, or to taste
directions: Warm milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat until small bubbles appear along the sides. Remove from heat.

Melt butter in another medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add flour once bubbles disappear. Cook, stirring constantly with a whisk, until mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Gradually whisk in the warm milk and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Cook and stir until the mixture is thick and smooth, 10 to 15 minutes. Reduce heat to low and stir in shredded cheese.
Add black beans, salsa, and the steak pieces. Stir and serve with tortilla chips.

recipes.name: Air-Fried Taco Dogs
directions: Preheat an air fryer to 390 degrees F (200 degrees C). Make sure the air fryer is at temperature for at least 4 minutes.
Cook hot dogs in the air fryer basket for 5 minutes. Place hot dogs in buns and return to the basket. Cook until buns are toasted and hot dogs are crisp, about 4 minutes more.
Top hot dogs with equal amounts of guacamole, salsa, and jalapenos.

recipes.name: Sausage Dip
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine Cheddar cheese, sour cream, tomatoes, mayonnaise, and jalapeno peppers in a medium bowl and mix until well blended. Pour into an 8x8-inch baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until melted, about 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook and stir sausage in a hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain excess grease.

recipes.name: Beef Enchilada Soup
directions: Cover and cook on Low for about 8 hours or High for about 4 hours.

recipes.name: Walking Tacos
ingredients: 6 (1.75 ounce) packages nacho cheese-flavored corn chips (such as Doritos\u00ae)
directions: Crush chips without opening the bags. Open bags and spoon in seasoned beef. Cover with cheese, tomatoes, lettuce, and sour cream. Stir to blend. Eat with forks right out of the bags.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Beef-Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 4 green bell peppers, tops and seeds removed
directions: Add olive oil to the inner liner of a multi-functional electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot\u00ae) and select Saute function. Add beef and onion to the hot oil and cook until beef is browned and no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Remove from pot and drain.

Pour 1 cup of water into the inner liner; set trivet inside and place stuffed bell peppers on top. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.

recipes.name: Poblano and Ground Pork Tacos
ingredients: 1 red onion, halved and thinly sliced
1 Roma tomato, seeded and finely chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 poblano pepper - cored, seeded, and finely chopped
directions: Mince a few slices of onion to get 1 tablespoon. Add minced onion, tomato, kiwi, juice from 2 lime wedges, 3/4 of the cilantro, salt, and pepper to a small bowl. Mix into a salsa.
Juice 1/4 of the lime into another small bowl; mix in sour cream to make the crema.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add sliced onion and poblano pepper. Cook, tossing occasionally, until softened and lightly charred, 3 to 4 minutes. Add pork and Mexican seasoning. Cook until pork is browned throughout, 4 to 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add chicken stock, tomato paste, salt, and pepper. Cook and stir until everything is coated, 1 to 2 minutes.
Wrap tortillas in a damp cloth and microwave for 30 seconds. Divide tortillas over plates; spread cream on top. Top tortillas with pork mixture and salsa. Garnish with remaining cilantro.

recipes.name: Mexican Taco Meatloaf
ingredients: \u00bc cup mild red taco sauce, or more to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Whisk eggs, milk, and taco sauce together in a separate bowl. Add to meat mixture and stir until well combined.
Press mixture into a 9x5-inch loaf pan and top with a strip of taco sauce down the center.
Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and browned on top, 45 to 60 minutes.

recipes.name: Holy Moly Taco Meatloaf
ingredients: 1 (14.5 ounce) can Mexican stewed tomatoes, chopped
\u00bc cup BBQ sauce, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and browned on top, about 1 hour.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Fiesta Chicken Burrito Bowl
ingredients: 2 (4 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
directions: Toss chicken breast pieces with garlic salt and black pepper in a bowl.

Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot\u00ae) and select Saute function. Melt butter. Add salsa and chicken; stir to combine. Pour black beans and corn into separate small silicone bowls. Place bowls on opposite sides of the Instant Pot\u00ae, nestling the chicken between them. Place elevated trivet into the Instant Pot\u00ae. Set the container of rice on top of the trivet. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 4 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 11 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove rice from trivet. Remove trivet. Blend corn and black beans with the chicken.
Add equal amounts of rice to 4 serving bowls. Top with chicken mixture.

recipes.name: Mexican Pork Chop Casserole
ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed
1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce, or more to taste
1 red bell pepper, sliced into rings
1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook pork chops in the hot oil, in batches if necessary, until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes. Transfer chops to a 9x13-inch baking dish and season with salt. Pour rice around the pork chops.

Bake in the preheated oven until rice is tender and liquid is mostly absorbed, about 1 hour. Remove cover and top with bell pepper rings and Cheddar cheese. Continue baking until cheese is melted, about 15 minutes more.

recipes.name: Magic Vegan Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 2 tablespoons hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco\u00ae) (Optional)
3 red bell peppers, stemmed and seeded
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine water and brown rice in a rice cooker. Cook according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, husk corn and peel off the silk. Wrap in a damp paper towel and microwave for 5 minutes. Let cool for at least 1 minute. Cut kernels from the cob.
Spoon mixture into the bell peppers. Prop peppers up in a loaf pan so they don't fall over.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 40 minutes.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Hot Bean Dip
ingredients: 2 cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided
directions: Mix cream cheese and sour cream together in a bowl.
Smooth mixture evenly over the bottom of a slow cooker.
Add remaining cheese on top of the mixture, spreading it evenly.
Cover and cook on High until heated through, about 2 hours.

recipes.name: Maria's Cinco de Mayo Enchilada Party Ring
ingredients: 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or more to taste
1 cup crushed corn chips (such as Frito's\u00ae), divided
1 (16 ounce) package corn chips (such as Fritos\u00ae), or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Reserve 2 tablespoons crushed chips and add remaining chips to chicken mixture. Stir to combine.

Sprinkle reserved crushed chips onto a cutting board. Unroll crescent roll dough and press into chips. Separate dough into triangles and arrange in a ring with points facing out on a baking sheet, leaving a 5-inch diameter open circle in the center. Scoop chicken mixture onto the wide end of each triangle. Fold edges of dough over to create a ring.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
Garnish with salsa, sour cream, and avocado. Serve with additional corn chips.

recipes.name: Awesome Irish Nachos
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded Mexican cheese blend
3 tablespoons sour cream, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Arrange waffle fries in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until light golden in color, 12 to 20 minutes.
Transfer baked fries to a 9x13-inch baking pan. Spread ground beef evenly over fries. Cover beef with cheese.
Return to the oven until cheese has melted, about 5 minutes.
Remove from the oven and garnish with tomatoes, olives, jalapenos, and lettuce. Dollop sour cream and guacamole on top.

recipes.name: Taco Pasta Salad with French Dressing
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package uncooked tri-color rotini pasta
1 (14 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 (8 ounce) package shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
1 (8 ounce) package nacho cheese-flavored corn chips (such as Doritos\u00ae), crushed
directions: Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil; cook rotini at a boil until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and let cool, about 10 minutes.
Combine cooled beef and rotini with French dressing, black beans, and Cheddar cheese. Mix well and chill until ready to serve.
Fold in lettuce, tomato, and green onions. Sprinkle crushed chips on top or serve on the side.

recipes.name: Zucchini Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package shredded extra-sharp Cheddar cheese
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Slice ends off zucchini and cut them lengthwise. Scoop out centers, leaving a 1/4-inch wall around each. Line up zucchini "boats" on a rimmed baking sheet.

Spoon chicken mixture evenly into zucchini boats. Pour enchilada sauce over each, making sure to cover any exposed zucchini and barely cover the bottom of the baking sheet. Top each with Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is just starting to brown, about 25 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Taco Hand Pies
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix tomatoes, onion, cilantro, jalapeno pepper, and garlic salt together in a mixing bowl.

Lightly flour a work surface. Roll each empanada wrapper out to a 6-inch circle. Scoop 1/3 cup beef filling onto the center of each wrapper. Fold each wrapper in half to enclose the filling. Crimp edges with a fork to seal. Pierce the top of each pie twice with a fork. Transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
Whisk egg and water together to make egg wash. Brush egg wash over the tops of the pies.
Bake on the middle rack of the preheated oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Homemade Hamburger Mac
ingredients: 2 cups canned diced tomatoes, with juices
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot\u00ae) and select Saute function. Add beef and saute, breaking meat up as it cooks, until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove beef and drain in a colander to remove excess fat.
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 3 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, for 5 minutes. Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

recipes.name: Ground Turkey Taco Nachos
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
48 corn tortilla chips, or as needed
directions: Add 1 cup pico de gallo, broccoli slaw, and chopped bell peppers. Cook, stirring occasionally, until peppers begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Stir in diced tomatoes and tomato sauce; cook until simmering and heated through, about 5 minutes.
Divide tortilla chips evenly and layer onto 4 microwave-safe plates. Spoon turkey mixture on top, sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, and spray with cooking spray.
Microwave each plate on high until cheese has melted, about 1 minute. Serve with remaining pico de gallo.

recipes.name: Taco Cheesecake
directions: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Stir tortilla chips and butter together in a bowl. Press into the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Remove crust from oven, leaving oven on. Cool on a wire rack.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add beef and cook, stirring, until crumbly and no longer pink, 7 to 10 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Pat beef dry with paper towels and return to the skillet.

Beat cream cheese in a bowl using an electric mixer until fluffy. Add eggs and reserved taco seasoning mix, beating until blended. Add Cheddar cheese and beat until blended. Spread mixture evenly over crust and 1 inch up sides of pan. Spoon in beef mixture.
Combine sour cream and flour in a bowl; spread over cheesecake.
Bake in the hot oven for 25 minutes.
Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Run a knife around the edges and release sides of pan.
Serve warm, cold, or room temperature with a topping of lettuce, tomato, and avocado.

recipes.name: Chicken Tostadas
ingredients: \u00bc cup sour cream, or to taste (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Spread a thin layer of refried beans onto each tostada shell; sprinkle each with Mexican cheese. Divide cooked chicken on top of cheese layer. Sprinkle tomato, red onion, and bell pepper evenly on top of each tostada. Place tostadas on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until crispy, 10 to 15 minutes.
Remove tostadas from the oven. Sprinkle with cilantro and spread salsa and sour cream on top.

recipes.name: Mexican Succotash
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can baby lima beans, drained
directions: Add corn and lima beans to pan and stir. Let simmer until lima beans are tender and heated through, about 5 minutes more.

recipes.name: Stuffed Poblanos
directions: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Place peppers onto the prepared baking sheet. Cook under the preheated broiler until the skin of the peppers has blackened and blistered, 5 to 8 minutes. Remove peppers and turn the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Place blackened peppers into a zip-top bag and let steam as they cool, about 15 minutes. Pull off and discard the outer skins, being careful not to tear the peppers. Slice peppers down one side and remove seeds.
Add stuffing to peppers and place in a baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Chicken Taco Bowl
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can ranch-style beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Pour remaining broth into the pot, making sure rice is submerged. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 22 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 12 minutes.

Carefully pull out chicken breasts; let rest on a cutting board. Fluff rice lightly to keep it from clumping together and cover with lid for 5 minutes more. Shred chicken with 2 forks in the meantime.
Serve rice in bowls topped with shredded chicken.

recipes.name: Easy Slow Cooker Chicken Tacos
ingredients: 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste
1 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste
1 teaspoon garlic powder, or to taste
1 (20 ounce) can pineapple chunks, drained with juice reserved
directions: Cover and cook on Low until chicken is ready to shred, 4 to 5 hours. Remove chicken, shred with 2 forks, and return to the slow cooker.
Break up the pineapple chunks and add them to the slow cooker with 1/4 cup of pineapple juice (or more to taste) and onion slices. Cook on Low until sauce is bubbling and fragrant, 1 to 2 hours.

recipes.name: Buttermilk Roast Chicken Drumsticks
ingredients: 3 cloves garlic, bruised and skins removed
3 drops liquid smoke, or to taste (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a roasting pan with aluminum foil.
Remove drumsticks from the marinade and shake off excess. Place drumsticks in the prepared pan and drizzle with 2 tablespoons oil. Discard the remaining marinade.
Roast in the preheated oven until the drumsticks are well browned, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Chicken Tacos
ingredients: 1 (1 ounce) envelope chicken taco seasoning mix (such as McCormick\u00ae)
directions: Release pressure using the quick release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Select the keep warm setting. Transfer chicken to a cutting board and let cool for 10 minutes.
Shred chicken and return back to the pot for 3 minutes or until heated through.

recipes.name: Sarah's Stewed Taco Burgers
directions: Mince enough onion to get 1/4 cup. Set remaining onion aside.
Transfer onion to a medium bowl; add ground beef, 2 teaspoons taco seasoning, and garlic powder. Mix well and shape into 4 hamburger patties.
Pour tomato sauce into a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add salsa and remaining 1 teaspoon taco seasoning. Mix to combine.

Shave remaining onion into thin slices using a mandolin. Add to tomato mixture. Add hamburger patties and cook in the sauce until internal temperature reaches 170 degrees F (76 degrees C), about 5 minutes per side.
Toast the hamburger buns if desired. Top buns with hamburger patties and sauce, and other desired toppings.

recipes.name: Kid-Friendly Chicken Chimichangas
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Turn chimichangas over and bake 15 minutes more.
Serve topped with Cheddar cheese, salsa, and sour cream.

recipes.name: Easy Beef Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained (Optional)
1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.

Warm tortillas in the microwave for about 1 minute. Spoon about 1/4 cup of the beef mixture into the center of each tortilla. Roll tortillas up and place in the casserole dish, seam-side down. Spoon any leftover sauce, black beans, and olives over the tortillas. Sprinkle remaining cheese over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and filling is bubbling, about 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Taco Salad Pizza
ingredients: \u00bd cup black beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
Unwrap pizza and place on a baking sheet. Spread meat and bean mixture evenly over the crust. Add pepper Jack cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 12 minutes.
While pizza is baking, combine sour cream and hot sauce in a small bowl. Transfer to a small zip-top bag and place in the refrigerator.
Allow pizza to cool for about 5 minutes, then top with lettuce, tomato, jalapeno, cilantro, and tortilla strips.
Snip off a corner of the zip-top bag and drizzle the sour cream and hot sauce mixture over the pizza.

recipes.name: Soy Chorizo Taco Filling
ingredients: 8 ounces soy chorizo, cut into bite-sized pieces
2 green bell peppers, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 red bell peppers, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 medium onion, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 tablespoon taco seasoning mix, or to taste
1 teaspoon hot sauce, or to taste (Optional)
1 teaspoon paprika, or more to taste (Optional)

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Cheesy Mexican Lentils and Rice
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste
directions: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 10 minutes.
Open the lid and stir in 1/2 of the Mexican cheese blend. Sprinkle remaining cheese over the top. Put the lid back on top and let sit for 4 minutes. Garnish with cilantro.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Spicy Chicken Spaghetti Casserole with Frozen Chicken Breasts
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL\u00ae)
1 (10.5 ounce) can low-sodium cream of mushroom soup
1 (10.5 ounce) can low-sodium cream of chicken soup
\u00bd teaspoon chicken seasoning salt (such as Chook\u00ae) (Optional)
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot\u00ae) and select Saute function. Add in butter and onion and saute for about 3 minutes. Pour in diced tomatoes with liquid; mix to combine. Add frozen chicken breasts. Cancel Saute mode.
Close and lock the lid. Select High pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 20 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove chicken and cut into bite-sized pieces. Add chicken back into the pot. Scatter noodles on top so they don't clump up.

Mix mushroom soup, chicken soup, and milk together in a bowl. Pour over noodles. Close and lock the lid. Select High pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 7 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler. Spray an 8x12-inch casserole dish with cooking spray.
Transfer 1/2 of the spaghetti mixture to the casserole dish and sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Add remaining spaghetti mixture and sprinkle with remaining 1 1/2 cups cheese.
Broil in the preheated oven until the cheese is bubbling and golden, 3 to 5 minutes.

recipes.name: Air Fryer Keto Chicken Wings
directions: Preheat the air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 2 minutes.
Place wings in the air fryer and cook for 12 minutes, turning after 6 minutes. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Mexican Lentil Soup
ingredients: 1 fresh jalape\u00f1o chile pepper, seeded and chopped
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot\u00ae) and select Saute function. Add olive oil and let heat for 1 minute. Add carrot, onion, bell pepper, and jalapeno; saute for 2 minutes. Add garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Hit Cancel.

Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 10 minutes. Remove the lid and stir in cilantro and lime juice. Ladle into bowls and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Steak Tacos
ingredients: 1 (1.1 oz) package dry mesquite marinade mix (such as McCormick\u00ae Grill Mates\u00ae)
2 pounds beef top sirloin, thinly sliced
1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed
directions: Combine marinade mix, 1/4 cup water, and 1/4 cup oil in a bowl with an airtight lid. Add steak, seal the lid, and shake until coated with marinade.

Add water to the Instant Pot\u00ae and scrape steak bits from the bottom. Add bell peppers and onion. Close and lock the lid, select high pressure, and set the timer for 2 minutes. Allow 5 to 10 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes, making sure to cover with a towel to prevent splatter. Unlock and remove the lid.

recipes.name: Vegan Sweet Potato and Bean Burritos
ingredients: 1 cup sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1/4-inch cubes
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Roast in the preheated oven, about 30 minutes or until desired level of doneness.
Spread 1/4 of the beans down the center of each tortilla. Top each tortilla with 1/4 cup rice, 1/4 of the vegetable mixture, and 1 tablespoon salsa.

recipes.name: Taco-Meatloaf Muffins
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
\u00bc cup taco sauce, or as needed
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 30 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Let cool 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Hungry Dad's Mexican-Inspired Casserole
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers
1 (8 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1\u2009\u00bd cups shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided
1\u2009\u00bd cups shredded pepper Jack cheese, divided
\u00bc cup sour cream, or to taste
directions: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Spread flour tortillas in the prepared baking dish, overlapping to cover the bottom and sides. Spread beef mixture over tortillas, and sprinkle with 3/4 cup Monterey Jack cheese, 3/4 cup pepper Jack cheese, and 1 1/2 cups crushed tortilla chips. Cover with aluminum foil.

Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and discard foil. Sprinkle remaining Monterey Jack cheese, pepper Jack cheese, and crushed tortilla chips on top. Place back in the oven and bake, uncovered, until cheese is melted and bubbly, 8 to 10 minutes. Sprinkle with green onion and cilantro and serve with sour cream.

recipes.name: Easy One-Skillet Ground Beef Burrito
ingredients: 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, partially drained
4 (8 inch) flour tortillas, cut into strips
1 (8 ounce) carton sour cream, or to taste
directions: Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove ground beef to a paper towel-lined plate and drain and discard grease from the skillet.

recipes.name: Instant Pot\u00ae Chicken Taco Soup
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can roasted tomatoes with green chiles (such as Ro-Tel\u00ae)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot\u00ae) and select Saute function. Add onion and butter to the hot pot. Cook and stir until fragrant and onion has softened, about 3 minutes, adding garlic during the last 30 seconds. Remove onion mixture to a small bowl. Hit Cancel. Add chicken broth, chicken breast, and rice.
Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Remove chicken breast, and shred.

Add tomatoes and corn to the pot, along with shredded chicken. Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 3 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

recipes.name: Creamy Chicken Enchiladas with White Sauce
ingredients: 2 (12.5 fl oz) cans chicken breast chunks, drained
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL\u00ae)
\u00bc cup green (mild) hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco\u00ae)
directions: Mix condensed soup, diced tomatoes, Greek yogurt, milk, hot pepper sauce, lime juice, oregano, chili powder, and cumin together in a saucepan; bring to a simmer over medium heat. Simmer sauce for 10 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Wrap chicken mixture in tortillas and arrange in a 9x13-inch baking pan. Pour sauce on top and sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is golden brown, about 30 minutes.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Mexican Chicken Soup
ingredients: 6 boneless chicken thighs, or more to taste
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
1 tablespoon shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste (Optional)
1 tablespoon sour cream, or to taste (Optional)
1 tablespoon crushed tortilla chips, or to taste (Optional)
1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste (Optional)
directions: Place chicken thighs in a large pot of water. Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to medium-high and boil until no longer pink in the centers, about 30 minutes. Remove from the pot and let cool until able to handle, about 10 minutes. Shred chicken.
Serve topped with Cheddar cheese, sour cream, tortilla chips, and cilantro.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Deconstructed Peppers
ingredients: 1 pound vegetarian ground beef substitute (such as Beyond Meat\u00ae Beyond Beef\u00ae)
\u00bc cup shredded Mexican cheese blend, or to taste (Optional)
\u00bc cup sour cream, or to taste (Optional)
1 tablespoon sliced black olives, or to taste (Optional)
directions: Pour chicken broth and rice into the pot. Hit Cancel. Seal and lock the lid into place.
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid. Serve immediately and garnish with Mexican cheese, sour cream, black olives, and avocado.

recipes.name: Vitamix\u00ae Tortilla Soup
ingredients: 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with lime juice and cilantro (such as RO*TEL\u00ae)
2 sprigs fresh cilantro, or more to taste
\u00bc cup canned black beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Combine chicken broth, diced tomatoes, jalapeno Jack cheese, Roma tomatoes, carrot, celery, bell pepper, avocado, garlic, taco mix, salt, and cilantro in a high-speed blender (such as Vitamix\u00ae). Mix at level 10 for a few seconds, then at full speed until steaming, 6 to 7 minutes.
Pour black beans and corn into the blender and pulse two times. Serve soup over over shredded chicken.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Chicken and Rice
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces

recipes.name: Tex-Mex Squash Casserole with Rotel\u00ae
ingredients: 1 clove garlic, minced, or to taste
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL\u00ae)
1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).

Heat oil in the skillet over medium heat. Mix in squash, onion, and garlic; saute until tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add beef and diced tomatoes to the skillet. Season with cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Transfer mixture to an oven-proof casserole dish. Top with Mexican cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Chipotle Turkey Tacos
ingredients: 6 peppers chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
10 piece (blank)s pineapple chunks in juice, drained, juice reserved
directions: Remove chipotle peppers from sauce and slice into thin strips; keep adobo sauce for later.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add ground turkey, stirring to break up while cooking, until mostly browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add pineapple chunks, onion, and chipotle peppers. Cook until turkey is no longer pink and fully cooked through, 3 to 4 minutes more.
Divide meat mixture evenly between tortillas and top with cilantro. Fold and serve.

recipes.name: Taco Meatballs
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch glass baking dish with cooking spray.
Form 1-inch balls from the mixture and place into the prepared dish so they aren't touching.
Bake in the preheated oven until browned and no longer pink in the centers, about 30 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes and serve.

recipes.name: Vegetarian Breakfast Tacos
ingredients: 5 ounces plant-based "ground beef" (such as Beyond Meat\u00ae Beefy Crumbles)
directions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir "beef" crumbles, green bell pepper, onion, and garlic in the hot skillet until tender, 3 to 4 minutes.

Pour eggs into the skillet and scramble until set, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cheese and salsa until cheese has melted and filling is well combined. Serve with warmed flour tortillas.

recipes.name: Feijoada de Domingo (Sunday Bean Stew)
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 pound dried beef, cut into pieces
1 pound spicy sausage, cut into pieces
\u00bd pound bacon, cut into large pieces
\u00bc pound pork belly, cut in half
1 unsalted pig's ear, cut into thirds
\u00bd pound bacon, cut into small pieces
directions: Combine 6 quarts water, black beans, bay leaves, salt, and pepper in a large saucepan. Bring to boil; simmer for 50 minutes.

Bring remaining 2 quarts water to boil in a large saucepan. Stir in dried beef, pork ribs, and pig's feet; simmer until flavors combine, about 25 minutes. Add smoked sausage, spicy sausage, large bacon pieces, pork belly, pig's ear, and pig's tails; simmer until meat mixture is softened, about 25 minutes.
Stir meat mixture to the bean mixture; simmer until flavors combine, about 45 minutes.
